event.name: EICS 2026
event.description: The 18th ACM SIGCHI Symposium on Engineering Interactive Computing Systems

topics: Modelling, specification and analysis of interaction and interactive systems
Methods, processes, principles and/or tools for building interactive systems
Formal methods within interactive systems engineering
Bridging the gap between engineering and design practices
Computational techniques for designing and evaluating interactive systems
Explore and/or employ of diverse interaction techniques and devices
Engineering hardware or software integration in interactive systems
Engineering interactive systems for diverse user groups
Applying AI technologies in methods, processes and tools for building interactive systems

guidelines.general: A newcomer’s guide to EICS is available at https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3300960

submission_details.overview: EICS Full Papers and Technical Notes are published as articles in the Journal Proceedings of the ACM on Human-Computer Interaction (PACM - EICS series).
submission_details.submission_process: Papers may be accepted after submission and review, or may be recommended for revisions and re-submission.
submission_details.focus: Submissions should present original and mature research work within the scope of the conference.
submission_details.technical_notes: Focus on elucidating technical details of complex interactive systems.
submission_details.length_restrictions: There are no length restrictions on Full Papers and Technical Notes.
submission_details.acm_format: Full Papers and Technical Notes should be written in the ACM format, see https://www.acm.org/publications/authors/submissions
submission_details.human_participants: Papers should comply with the ACM policy on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects.
